title: Game Scores & Schedules
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about game scores.

i.e.
- Who won the teamName game?
- Who won the teamName vs teamName game?
- Who is winning the teamName game?
- What is the score of the teamName game?
- What was the score of last night's teamName game?
- What was the score of the teamName game on gameDate?
- Who won the last teamName vs teamName game?
- What was the score of the last teamName vs teamName game?
- Who was the losing pitcher in last night's teamName game?
- Who was the winning pitcher in last night's teamName game?
custom_expected: THEN the feature should support all queries about past and current games.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user asks scheduling questions about a single team

i.e.
- Did the Yankees win yesterday?
- Who do the Mets play on August 21st?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with standard schedule lookup

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user asks when two teams played or will play each other

i.e. 
- When did the Mets and Pirates last play?
- When is the next time the A's play the Angels?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with Team vs. Team info

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user asks about pitchers in upcoming games
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with pitcher info
AND should be able to tell users the starting pitchers for most games up to four or five days in advance

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a user asks about scheduling questions about home/away, day/night, and vs. opponent

i.e.
- When is the next Brewers day game at home?
- When is the next time the A's play a day game at Fenway?
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bot replies with advanced schedule lookup info

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user asks about the score of a specific live game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with scores info
AND should be able to tell users the current score of a game

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN a user asks about the score of a specific past game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bot replies with scores info
AND should be able to tell users the score of a past game

title: Won/Lost - Past Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: past
custom_steps: WHEN the user asks a query about who won or lost
custom_expected: THEN this is a past tense request and should default to the most recent game played by that team

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query about who won or lost
AND the user asks a query for only one team
AND the team lost

i.e. Who won the Mets game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context to of the requested team.  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam lost to the winningTeam, score, on gameDate.

i.e. The Mets lost to the Nationals 5 - 2 on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query about who won or lost
AND the user asks a query for only one team
AND the team won

i.e. Who won the Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context to of the requested team.  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam beat the winningTeam score on gameDate.

i.e. The Nationals beat the Mets 5 - 2 on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
REVIEW

WHEN the user asks a query about who won or lost
AND the user asks a query for both teams

i.e. Who won the Nationals vs Mets game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
REVIEW

THEN the response should be winning team beat losing team.  The response is in the following format:
- The winningTeam beat the losingTeam score on gameDate.

i.e. The Nationals beat the Mets 5 - 2 on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query about who won or lost
AND the game results are tied
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context to of the requested team.  The response is in the following format:
- The team1 tied the team2, score, on gameDate. 

i.e. The Nationals tied the Mets, 5-5, on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://scoreboard?state=expanded&gameid=2015_07_06_cinmlb_wasmlb_1

title: Score Check - Live Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present
custom_steps: WHEN the user asks a query about the score for a live game
custom_expected:
THEN this is a present tense request that should first default to a live/current game
AND fall back on the most recent past game.

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for only one team
AND the team is winning

i.e. 
- Who is winning the Nationals game?
- What is the score of the Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context of the requested team (note leading vs trailing). The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam are leading the losingTeam, score, in the inning.

i.e. The Nationals are leading the Mets 8 - 4 in the top of the 7th inning.

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for only one team
AND the team is losing

i.e. 
- Who is winning the Mets game?
- What is the score of the Mets game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context of the requested team (note leading vs trailing).  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam are trailing the winningTeam score in the inning.

i.e. The Mets are trailing the Nationals 8 - 4 in the top of the 7th inning.

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for only one team
AND the game score is tied
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam are currently tied with the team2, score, in the inning inning. 

i.e. The Nationals are currently tied with the Mets, 3-3, in the bottom of the 6th inning.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://scoreboard?state=expanded&gameid=2015_07_06_cinmlb_wasmlb_1

title: Score Check - Past Game in Current Year
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: past
custom_steps: WHEN the user asks a query about the score for a past game
custom_expected:
THEN this is a past tense request and the response should retain the context of the team that was requested (note leading vs trailing). 
If there was no game on the requested date, default to most recent game result.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND the team won

i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam beat the losingTeam, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday{/if}.

i.e. The Nationals beat the Mets 8 - 4 yesterday.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND the team lost

i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam lost to the winningTeam, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday{/if}.

i.e. The Nationals lost to the Mets 5 - 4 yesterday.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND there is no game on requested date
AND the requested team beat the opposing team in the most recent game result

i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- There was no requestedTeam game yesterday, but the requestedTeam beat the losingTeam, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday

i.e. There was no Nationals game yesterday, but the Nationals beat the Mets, 8-4, on May 17, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND there is no game on requested date
AND the requested team lost to the opposing team in the most recent game result
i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- There was no requestedTeam game yesterday, the requestedTeam lost to the winningTeam, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday

i.e. There was no Nationals game yesterday, but the Nationals lost to the Mets, 8-4, on May 17, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND the score is tied

i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The team1 tied the team2, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday{/if} gameDate. 

i.e. The Nationals tied the Mets, 5-5, on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user asks a query about the score for a past game for only one team
AND there is no game on requested date
AND the score is tied

i.e. 
- What was the score of last night's Nationals game?
- What was the score of yesterday's Nationals game?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- There was no requestedTeam game yesterday, but the team1 tied the team2, score, {#if gameDate > 1 day from current date}on gameDate{else} yesterday{/if} gameDate. 

i.e. There was no Nationals game yesterday, The Nationals tied the Mets, 5-5, on May 4, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content: Deeplink
custom_steps_separated.expected: mlbatbat://scoreboard?state=expanded&gameid=2015_07_06_cinmlb_wasmlb_1

title: CON'T EDING FROM HERE.... Score Check - Past Game on Specific Date
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the score for a past game on a specific date
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: 2017
- utterance tense: past
custom_expected: THEN this is a past tense request and the response should retain the context of the team that was requested (note leading vs trailing)

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for only one team for a specific date
AND the team is winning

i.e. What was the score of the Nationals game on May 7, 2017?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam beat the losingTeam score on gameDate.

i.e. The Nationals beat the Mets 8 - 4 on May 7, 2017.

custom_steps_separated.content:
The user asks a query for only one team for a specific date
AND the team is losing

i.e. What was the score of the Nationals game on May 7, 2017?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam lost to the winningTeam score on gameDate.

i.e. The Nationals lost to the Mets 5 - 4 on May 7, 2017.

title: Last Team vs Team Matchup - Past Game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the last team vs team matchup
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: n/a
- utterance tense: past

i.e. 
- Who won the last Nationals vs Mets game?
- What was the score of the last Nationals vs Mets game?
- What was the score the last time the Nationals played the Mets?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- The awayTeam played the homeTeam on gameDate at venue. The winningTeam won score.

i.e. The Nationals played the Mets on September 24, 2017 at Citi Field. The Nationals won 3 - 2.

title: Box Score - Past Game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about the box score of a past game
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: past

i.e. 
- Who was the losing pitcher in last night's Nationals game?
- Who was the winning pitcher in last night's Nationals game?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is in the following format:
- winningPitcher of the winningTeam was last night's winning pitcher imporving his record to winningPitcherRecord. The losingTeam losingPitcher was credited with the loss and falls to losingPitcherRecord.

i.e. Max Scherzer of the Washington Nationals was last night's winning pitcher improving his record to 5 - 2. The Mets' Matt Harvey was credited with the loss and falls to 4 - 5.

title: Today's Game Lookup
custom_steps:
WHEN the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: present

AND the user asks the queries below about today's game lookup

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN only one team is mentioned

i.e. 
- When do the Nationals play today?
- What time is the Nationals game (today)?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context to of the requested team. If it's a day game or night game, that should be indicated in the response with the use of today or tonight.  Game times should always be presented in the club's local time zone. For example, The Chicago Cubs schedule will always show games in Central time.  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam play the opponent today/tonight at gameTime timeZone time. Today/Tonight's game will be played at venue in venueCity, venueState.

i.e. The Nationals play the Mets tonight at 7:05 pm Eastern time. Tonight's game will be played at Nationals Park in Washington D.C.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN both teams are mentioned
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be away team plays home team.  

??????
If it's a day game or night game, that should be indicated in the response with the use of today or tonight. Game times should always be presented in the club's local time zone. For example, The Chicago Cubs schedule will always show games in Central time. The response is in the following format:

FORMAT:????????
- The awayTeam play the homeTeamt today/tonight at gameTime timeZone time. Today/Tonight's game will be played at venue in venueCity, venueState.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query regarding today's game lookup
AND then asks a follow up questions regarding the weather

i.e. 
- What's the weather?
- What will the weather be like?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN bot responds with the weather.  If it's a day game or night game, that should be indicated in the response with the use of today or tonight.  

i.e. The weather for tonight's game will be partly cloudy with a high of 75 degrees and a low of 68 degrees.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user asks a query regarding today's game lookup
AND then asks a follow up questions regarding probable pitchers

i.e. 
- Who are the starting pitchers?
- Who's pitching?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN if probable pitchers are available, they should be included in the response.  If it's a day game or night game, that should be indicated in the response with the use of today or tonight.  The response is in the following format:
- For today's/tonight's game, homeTeamPitcher is scheduled to pitch for the homeTeam and awayTeamPitcher is scheduled to pitch for the awayTeam.

i.e. For tonight's game, Max Scherzer is scheduled to pitch for the Nationals and Jacob DeGrom is scheduled to pitch for the Mets.

title: Future Game Lookup
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about a future game lookup
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: 2018
- utterance tense: future

AND the user asks the queries below about future game lookup

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN only one team is mentioned
AND if probable pitchers are available

i.e. Who do the Nationals play on July 18, 2018?
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be in context to of the requested team. Probable pitchers should be included in the response if available.  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam play the opponent on gameDate at gameTime timeZone time. The game will be played at venue in venueCity, venueState. Scheduled to pitch for the requestedTeam is requestedTeamPitcher and scheduled to pitch for the opponent is opponentPitcher.

i.e. The Nationals play the Mets on July 18, 2018 at 7:05 pm Eastern time. The game will be played at Nationals Park in Washington D.C. Scheduled to pitch for the Nationals is Max Scherzer and scheduled to pitch for the Mets is Jacob DeGrom.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN both teams are mentioned


?????
AND if probable pitchers are available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the response should be away team plays home team.


????
Probable pitchers should be included in the response if available.  The response is in the following format:
- The awayTeam play the homeTeam on gameDate at gameTime timeZone time. The game will be played at venue in venueCity, venueState. Scheduled to pitch for the requestedTeam is requestedTeamPitcher and scheduled to pitch for the opponent is opponentPitcher.

i.e. The Nationals play the Mets on July 18, 2018 at 7:05 pm Eastern time. The game will be played at Nationals Park in Washington D.C. Scheduled to pitch for the Nationals is Max Scherzer and scheduled to pitch for the Mets is Jacob DeGrom.

title: Future Game Splits
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about future game splits
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: future

i.e. 
- When is the next Nationals home game?
- When is the next Nationals day game?
custom_expected:
THEN game times should always be presented in the club's local time zone. For example, The Chicago Cubs schedule will always show games in Central time.  The response is in the following format:
- The requestedTeam next home game is on gameDate at gameTime timeZone vs opponent.

i.e. The Nationals next home game is on May 3, 2018 at 1:05 pm Eastern time vs the Mets.

title: Future Game Lookups vs Team
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about future game lookup vs team
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: future

i.e. 
- When is the next time the Nationals play the Dodgers?
- When do the Nationals play the Dodgers next?
custom_expected:
THEN game times should always be presented in the club's local time zone. For example, The Chicago Cubs schedule will always show games in Central time. The response is in the following format:
- The next requestedTeam vs opponent is on gameDate at gameTime timeZone time at venue in venueCity, venueState.

i.e. The next Nationals vs Dodgers game is on June 10, 2018 at 7:05 pm Pacific time at Dodger Stadium in Los Angeles, CA.

title: Future Game Lookups vs Team With Splits
custom_steps:
WHEN the user asks a query about future game lookups vs team with splits
AND the time frame is the following:

- request time: mid-season
- season type: regular season
- year: current year
- utterance tense: future

i.e. 
- When is the next Nationals day game at home?
- When is the next Nationals home night game?
custom_expected:
THEN game times should always be presented in the club's local time zone. For example, The Chicago Cubs schedule will always show games in Central time.  THEN the response is in the following format:
- The next requestedTeam day/night game at home is on gameDate at gameTime timeZone time vs the opponent.

i.e. The next Nationals night game at home is on June 10, 2018 at 7:05 pm Eastern time vs the Dodgers.
